poem:
### Aleppo's Boulevard

Ripped faces  
on torn posters  
flutter in the wind—  
a city's sigh.  
Empty roads echo  
the absence of wheels,  
while shadows of snipers  
watch from afar.  
Once bold in rebellion,  
now silence quivers—  
the price of rising  
etched in dust.  
Aleppo waits,  
a lesson suspended  
in time.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Inside Aleppo, the city Assad left to rot as a lesson in the price of rising up Bashar al-Assad’s face has been ripped away from posters at the abandoned checkpoint that separates Sheikh Maqsoud, a neighbourhood in the north of Aleppo, from the rest of the city. No cars dare use the wide boulevard any more because the road is still watched by Kurdish snipers allied to the regime. The units retreated into the warren". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Inside Aleppo, the city Assad left to rot as a lesson in the price of rising up Bashar al-Assad’s face has been ripped away from posters at the abandoned checkpoint that separates Sheikh Maqsoud, a neighbourhood in the north of Aleppo, from the rest of the city. No cars dare use the wide boulevard any more because the road is still watched by Kurdish snipers allied to the regime. The units retreated into the warren
